[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
, I have some exciting plans for the future that I wanted to share with you.
Oh really? What are they?
Well, I was thinking that we could work on a project together and maybe even become business partners.
Wow, that sounds amazing! What kind of project are you thinking about?
I was thinking about starting a marketing agency specialized in social media.
That's a great idea! I'd love to work with you on that. We could really make a difference in the industry.
Yes, exactly! And I think our skills complement each other's so well.
I totally agree. You're so creative and outgoing, while I'm more analytical and detail-oriented.
It's like we were meant to work together, right?
Absolutely! I can't wait to see what the future holds for us.
Me too. And honestly, it's a bit of a relief to finally have a solid plan for the future.
Yeah, I get that. Speaking of the future, how have you been doing with your sleeping problems?
It's been a slow process, but I've been making progress with it. I started doing yoga and meditation before bed, and that's been helping a lot.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Fun memories and future plans with friends', 'Related Summaries': 'Classmates A and B reminisce about past fun times together and make plans for future outings.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Classmates B: Speaking of parties, remember that time we all went out for Sarah's birthday? ### Classmates A: Oh yeah, that was so much fun! I loved singing karaoke with everyone. ### Classmates B: Me too! I'm looking forward to the next time we can all go out together. ### Classmates A: Definitely! We should plan something soon. Maybe a picnic in the park or a hike? ### Classmates B: I'm up for anything! As long as we're having fun together. ### Classmates A: Agreed! Having great friends like you guys is what makes life so awesome.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Sleep troubles and relaxation techniques', 'Related Summaries': 'Classmates A shares struggles with sleep and receives suggestions from Classmates B on relaxation techniques.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Classmates A: I am so tired today, I didn't sleep well last night. ### Classmates B: Oh no, what happened? ### Classmates A: I just couldn't get comfortable and my mind was racing. I tried everything, but nothing seemed to work. ### Classmates B: Have you tried any natural remedies or teas to help you relax? ### Classmates A: Yes, I've tried chamomile tea and lavender oil, but nothing seems to work. ### Classmates B: Maybe you should try some meditation or breathing exercises before bed. ### Classmates A: That's a good idea, I'll give it a try tonight. Thanks for the suggestion.' }
```
